arts.ttl: Bologna’s Italiano laments dropped points against Genoa
arts.sum: Bologna manager Vincenzo Italiano expressed his frustration after his team squandered a two-goal lead to draw 2-2 with Genoa at the Stadio Luigi Ferraris in their Serie A match. The result opened the 8th round of fixtures for the 2024/2025 season. Speaking to DAZN after the game, Italiano lamented: “We had the need to win and we showed it, but some chances made us lose 2 points.” The coach pointed to a key moment that changed the complexion of the match: “You know I never talk about episodes, but that ball that escaped Casale’s feet which reopened the game conditioned The post Bologna’s Italiano laments dropped points against Genoa appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Gilardino praises Genoa’s fighting spirit after thrilling draw with Bologna
arts.sum: Genoa manager Alberto Gilardino expressed his delight with his team’s performance following their 2-2 draw against Bologna at the Stadio Luigi Ferraris. The result ended a run of negative results for the Grifone, and Gilardino was particularly impressed with the character shown by his players. “What effort and emotion the boys gave me,” Gilardino began. “After conceding the second goal, perhaps in our best moment, it was possible not to find a favorable episode. The boys instead were great because we maintained awareness. We were good at staying in the game, today there was a great reaction from everyone.” The The post Gilardino praises Genoa’s fighting spirit after thrilling draw with Bologna appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Serie A | Genoa 2-2 Bologna: Match Report
arts.sum: Genoa staged a remarkable comeback to salvage a 2-2 draw against Bologna in a thrilling Serie A encounter at the Stadio Luigi Ferraris. The match began with Bologna dominating proceedings, as Riccardo Orsolini tested Genoa goalkeeper Nicola Leali on multiple occasions. The visitors finally broke the deadlock when Orsolini’s deflected shot wrong-footed Leali to give Bologna the lead. Bologna doubled their advantage early in the second half through Jens Odgaard, who capitalized on poor defending to fire home from the edge of the area. At 2-0 down, Genoa looked destined for another defeat in what has been a difficult season The post Serie A | Genoa 2-2 Bologna: Match Report appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Balotelli-Genoa deal on hold: Agent Raiola says “We’re waiting for the decision, Mario is ready”
arts.sum: The potential transfer of Mario Balotelli to Genoa remains in limbo. The 34-year-old striker, currently a free agent after his last stint with Adana Demirspor in Turkey, is eager to return to Serie A and awaits a final decision from the club. Genoa, currently struggling in 18th place with only 5 goals scored in their first 7 Serie A matches, are seeking offensive reinforcements. Balotelli’s candidacy came at an opportune moment, but the deal has been put on hold, leaving the former Italian international in a state of uncertainty. arts.ttl: Fresh starts in Genoa vs Bologna
arts.sum: Genoa (60%, 3/5) and Bologna (43%, 3/7) are the two sides that have scored on percentage the most goals in the last 15 minutes of play in Serie A this season. Bologna have the same target: they have scored eight points in seven matches so far and do not want to let the leaders get away in order to chase a European qualification again this season.
